alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Lavaca (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 1:58PM CST until January 28 at 2:34AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Navidad River at Strane Park affecting Jackson County. Navidad River near Speaks affecting Jackson and Lavaca Counties. Navidad River at Sublime affecting Lavaca County. Navidad River at Morales affecting Jackson and Lavaca Counties. Lavaca River near Edna affecting Jackson County. For the Navidad River...including Sublime, Speaks, Morales, Strane Park...Major flooding is forecast. For the Lavaca River...including Komensky, Breslau, Hallettsville, Edna...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Navidad River at Morales. * WHEN...From this evening to early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 34.0 feet, Major lowland flooding begins with several feet of water over the approaches to the County Road 283 bridge and water threatending the bridge floor. The lowest homes in the flood plain are threatened near Vienna and in northern Jackson County. Livestock should be removed from the flood plain from the headwaters to Lake Texana. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM CST Thursday the stage was 26.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 32.2 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 32.0 feet on 10/17/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Navidad River Morales 29.0 26.9 Thu 1 pm CST 32.2 30.2 14.6 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening.Friday morning at 800 AM CST.
